greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of ways of representing 2*prime(n) as the unordered sum of two primes.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 2*prime(23) = 166 can be represented in 6 ways as the unordered sum of two primes: 166 = 3+163 = 17+149 = 29+137 = 53+113 = 59+107 = 83+83, so a(23) = 6.
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, Mar 14 2006
ext: Edited, corrected and extended by _Klaus Brockhaus_, Dec 23 2006
